page.title: 12WILDLIFE : GAME
page.content: The following types of{game birds breed in the glen:{RED GROUSE}(numbers declining in past 5 years){BLACK {GROUSE}(numbers increasing){PTARMIGAN {CAPERCAILLIE}(ocassionally seen){GREY {PARTRIDGE}(almost gone due to agricultural changes) {PHEASANTS}are reared by the gamekeepers in the glen for sport. They are released in August ready for the shooting season. Last year 1,200 pheasants were reared and 500 were shot.So I think they have a good chance of escaping. {RED DEER }live on the high hills and eat the heather that grows there and are increasing in numbers. {ROE DEER }live lower than Red DEER. They live in the woods and are seen by the road and up the drive. They are also increasing in numbers.
